pr_title: [TE] [data-availability] Scheduling of data availability tasks & some clean up

timeline.bodyText: I think these name changes are great for adding clarity and consistency
timeline.author: harleyjj

replies.bodyText:
Do you suggest to change the naming convention?
From DetectionAlert -> Subscription? We have detection_alert_config_index table and all the subscription tasks are with the name "detection_alert_xxx".
replies.author: xiaohui-sun

replies.bodyText: DetectionScheduler can probably be changed to DetectionCronScheduler, since it is not the only scheduler to schedule detection tasks and it is the only cron based scheduler for detection.
replies.author: vincentchenjl

replies.bodyText:
@xiaohui-sun, yes, I have been consistently trying to enforce the usage of subscription rather than detection_alert in our code (this pr and in the past). detection_alert is a very confusing term.
The database still holds the references as detection_alert which is a little harder to migrate but eventually we should.
replies.author: akshayrai

timeline.bodyText:
"DataAvailability" is a heavily overloaded term now.
We have DataAvailabilityTaskScheduler which is actually "EventTriggerTaskScheduler".
Here we have another "data availability" task. It is too confusing.
Can you do a refactoring?
Also @vincentchenjl  FYI
timeline.author: xiaohui-sun

replies.bodyText: My thought here is that we keep DataAvailabilityTaskScheduler here, because all these tasks are scheduled based on data availability.  I agree that createDataAvailabilityTask is still confusing with the DataAvailabilityTaskScheduler, so maybe we can change it to createDataSLACheckTask, which is more descriptive.
replies.author: vincentchenjl

replies.bodyText:
@vincentchenjl agreed. Let's use data availability term for referring to the event (data available or not) and use Data SLA for the alerts that are setup based on these data availability events.
I will update accordingly.
replies.author: akshayrai

replies.bodyText: I like the term SLA since it is easy to understand.
replies.author: xiaohui-sun

timeline.bodyText: Why changing the interface to add endtime?
timeline.author: xiaohui-sun

replies.bodyText: This is just a utility method ensuring both the detection and SLA task have the same end time.
replies.author: akshayrai

replies.bodyText:
It is an overkill to add one additional parameter just for "ensuring both the detection and SLA task have the same end time".
People look at the util function will probably wonder - "why there is only endtime not starttime".
replies.author: xiaohui-sun

timeline.bodyText: Do you create data availability task elsewhere? Is this the only place to trigger data availability task?
timeline.author: xiaohui-sun

replies.bodyText:
Discussed offline. Data SLA task will be created in 2 cases.
a. Whenever the DetectionCronScheduler schedules a detection task.
b. Whenever the DataAvailabilityTaskScheduler does a fallback.
Note that we do not need to schedule a Data SLA task when a Data availability event arrives.
replies.author: akshayrai

timeline.bodyText: Do we only run availability detection together with the normal detection job?
timeline.author: xiaohui-sun

replies.bodyText:
In this PR yes. This PR is only addressing the availability of data for detection jobs. In the next phase, we will have a DataSLACronScheduler which will allow users to define custom SLAs independent of detection.
Updated description to reflect this.
replies.author: akshayrai

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe we can rename it to something like detectionIdToLastTaskCreateTimeMap? Because I think watermark is also overloaded in the context.  🙂
Not clear whether it's the detection last time stamp, task create time or the latest data point.
timeline.author: jihaozh

replies.bodyText:
+1
The only case that it stores watermark is when there is no task for the detection at all, which should be minor case.
replies.author: vincentchenjl

timeline.bodyText: Does the availability task and the detection task share the same cron?
timeline.author: jihaozh

replies.bodyText: Yes. This PR is only addressing the availability of data for detection jobs. In the next phase, we will have a DataSLACronScheduler which can have a different cron schedule.
replies.author: akshayrai

replies.bodyText: DataAvailabilityScheduler should be used for it. Probably we don't need another scheduler.
replies.author: xiaohui-sun

timeline.bodyText: Why this line is only executed whenDetectionUtils.isDataAvailabilityCheckEnabled(detectionConfig) is true?
timeline.author: vincentchenjl

replies.bodyText: This is a flag to enable/disable data sla checks.
replies.author: akshayrai

timeline.bodyText: Should we can call it ThirdEyeCronScheduler to be more specific? I am not sure the interfaces defined here apply to any scheduler that listens to external events, data availability for instance. Even we can put the instance of Quatz scheuler here.
timeline.author: vincentchenjl
